label: Sandy Island Plantation Journal, Volume 2, 1797
description: This is a Sandy Island plantation journal written inside of the South Carolina and Georgia Almanac for the year 1797.  The plantation journal documents the planting of crops (rice, corn and potatoes), slave records, accounts, the weather, and business relations with Laurel Hill Plantation.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: This is a Sandy Island plantation journal written inside of the South Carolina and Georgia Almanac for the year 1797.  The plantation journal documents the planting of crops (rice, corn and potatoes), slave records, accounts, the weather, and business relations with Laurel Hill Plantation.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information and re-use requirements contact the South Carolina Historical Society, Charleston, SC, 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 600 dpi, 48-bit depth, color, Sinarback eVolution 86, Sinar. Archival masters are tiffs.
